issue.title: Prefer hosting-independent URL for quarkiverse docs

labels.name: area/platform
labels.description: Issues related to definition and interaction with Quarkus Platform

labels.name: area/devtools
labels.description: Issues/PR related to maven, gradle, platform and cli tooling/plugins

labels.name: area/infra-automation
labels.description: anything related to CI, bots, etc. that are used to automated our infrastructure

labels.name: area/docstyle
labels.description: issues related for manual docstyle review

issue.body:
I noticed new extensions are still being created with a docs url of the form http://quarkiverse.github.io/quarkiverse-docs. We should prefer the https://docs.quarkiverse.io url, partly because it's shorter and prettier, but also because it's not coupled to a hosting provider. 

I started out fixing just the extension templates, but then I decided that while I was searching I'd change the other occurrences, too.

body:
this looks like its missing parameterization, should be something like:

`https://docs.quarkiverse.io/{extension-name}/dev/index.html`

to have it be using the right naming convention.

The relative-guide-section is used by codestarts in the readme (and previously in the index.html) to point to the exact guide section related to the codestart (because some guide a very generic and the codestart can be about a specific section inside it)

issue.title: Fix hardcoded URL in generated codestart.yml
